IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: REDUCTION, ELIMINATION AND CURE OF BREAST CANCER
IRS990.MissionDescription: THE MISSION OF THE BREAST CANCER RESEARCH FOUNDATION IS TO ACHIEVE PREVENTION AND A CURE FOR BREAST CANCER IN OUR LIFETIME BY PROVIDING CRITICAL FUNDING FOR INNOVATIVE CLINICAL AND TRANSLATIONAL RESEARCH AT LEADING MEDICAL CENTERS WORLDWIDE, AND INCREASING PUBLIC AWARENESS ABOUT GOOD BREAST HEALTH.
IRS990.Description: THE BREAST CANCER RESEARCH FOUNDATION (BCRF) WAS FOUNDED IN 1993 BY EVELYN H. LAUDER AS AN INDEPENDENT, NOT-FOR-PROFIT 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATION DEDICATED TO FUNDING INNOVATED CLINICAL AND TRANSLATIONAL RESEARCH. THE FOUNDATION SUPPORTS SCIENTISTS AND LEADING MEDICAL CENTERS WORLDWIDE WHOSE RESEARCH IS FOCUSED ON ACHIEVING PREVENTION AND A CURE FOR BREAST CANCER IN OUR LIFETIME. A MINIMUM OF 85 CENTS OF EACH DOLLAR DONATED TO THE FOUNDATION GOES DIRECTLY TO BREAST CANCER RESEARCH AND AWARENESS PROGRAMS. BREAST CANCER IS THE MOST COMMON FORM OF CANCER (AFTER SKIN CANCER) IN WOMEN IN THE UNITED STATES. THE AMERICAN CANCER SOCIETY ESTIMATED THAT IN 2010, 207,090 NEW CASES OF INVASIVE BREAST CANCER WILL BE DIAGNOSED IN THE UNITED STATES AND 39,840 WOMEN WILL DIE FROM THE DISEASE. THE CHANCE OF DYING FROM BREAST CANCER IS ABOUT 1 IN 35. THESE STATISTICS, AND THE FACT THAT CLINICAL RESEARCH CONTINUES TO BE UNDER-FUNDED IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR, EXPLAINS THE EXISTENCE OF THE BREAST CANCER RESEARCH FOUNDATION. SINCE ITS INCEPTION, THE FOUNDATION HAS RAISED MORE THAN $290 MILLION - OVER $35 MILLION IN FISCAL YEAR 2010 ALONE - TO SUPPORT CLINICAL AND TRANSLATIONAL RESEARCH AT MEDICAL INSTITUTIONS ACCROSS THE GLOBE CONDUCTING THE MOST ADVANCED AND PROMISING BREAST CANCER RESEARCH THAT WILL HELP LEAD TO THE PREVENTION AND A CURE IN OUR LIFETIME. IN OCTOBER 2010, BCRF WILL DISTRIBUTE GRANTS OF APPROXIMATELY $33 MILLION TO 172 RESEARCHERS ACROSS THE UNITED STATES AND EUROPE, AND IN AUSTRALIA, CANADA, LATIN AMERICA AND THE MIDDLE EAST. A NUMBER OF IMPORTANT ADVANCES IN BREAST CANCER TREATMENT ANNOUNCED OVER THE PAST TWO YEARS - INCLUDING THE DISCOVERY OF NEW GENETIC RISK MAKERS FOR BREAST CANCER, AND THE PUBLICATION OF A STUDY DEMONSTRATING THAT LOW LEVELS OF VITAMIN D ARE ASSOCIATED WITH INCREASED RISK OF BREAST CANCER - WERE MADE POSSIBLE IN PART BY GRANTS FROM BCRF. BCRF KEEPS ADMINISTRATIVE COSTS AS LOW AS POSSIBLE, AND IN FISCAL 2009, OVERHEAD WAS ONLY 8% OF REVENUES. AS A RESULT, THE FOUNDATION HAS RECEIVED EXCEPTIONAL RECOGNITION FROM SEVERAL ORGANIZATIONS THAT MONITOR AND PROVIDE COMPREHENSIVE, UNBIASED INFORMATION ON CHARITIES. MOST NOTABLY, THE AMERICAN INSTITUTE OF PHILANTHROPY HAS AWARDED BCRF WITH ITS HIGHEST RATING, "A+". BCRF IS THE ONLY BREAST CANCER ORGANIZATION TO RECEIVE THIS ACCOLADE; INDEED, WE ARE THE ONLY CANCER ORGANIZATION TO CURRENTLY HOLD THIS RANKING.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: FORM 990, SCHEDULE D, PART X, LINE 2
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: IN FISCAL-YEAR 2010, THE FOUNDATION ADOPTED THE PROVISIONS OF ACCOUNTING STATNDARDS CODIFICATION ("ASC") 740-10-05 RELATING TO ACCOUNTING AND REPORTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES. DUE TO THE FOUNDATION'S GENERAL TAX-EXEMPT STATUS, ASC 740-10-05 HAS NOT HAD, AND IS NOT ANTICIPATED TO HAVE, A MATERIAL IMPACT ON THE FOUNDATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: FORM 990, SCHEDULE D, PART XII LINE 4B AND PART XIII LINE 4B
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: DURING THE FISCAL-YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2010, A GRANTEE RETURNED UNEXPENDED GRANTS FUNDS OF $11,979. FOR FINANCIAL STATEMENT REPORTING, THIS AMOUNT WAS NETTED AGAINST GRANT EXPENSE. FOR TAX RETURN REPORTING, THIS AMOUNT IS REPORTED AS MISCELLANEOUS REVENUE.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: NARRATIVE AND FINANCIAL PROGRESS REPORTS ARE REQUIRED TWICE YEARLY, FEBRUARY 1 AND SEPTEMBER 1, WITH A FINAL FINANCIAL REPORT DUE AT THE CONCLUSION OF THE GRANT YEAR. THESE REPORTS, WHICH ARE REVIEWED BY THE DEPUTY DIRECTOR AND SCIENTIFIC ADVISORS, ARE SUBMITTED ELECTRONICALLY VIA THE FOUNDATION'S WEB PORTAL, WITH PRINTED REPORTS MAILED SEPARATELY.

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: EMPLOYEES OF THE BREAST CANCER RESEARCH FOUNDATION, INC ARE PAID COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS BY ANOTHER ENTITY AND THAT ENTITY IS REIMBURSED FOR THE EXPENSES. NO EMPLOYEES WERE REPORTED ON FORM W-3 FOR THIS REASON

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: EVELYN LAUDER, JEANETTE WAGNER AND DEBORAH KRULEWITCH ALL WORK OR HAVE WORKED FOR THE SAME EMPLOYER, THE ESTEE LAUDER COMPANIES, INC., AND ARE OR WERE CORPORATE OFFICERS

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE DRAFT FORM 990 WAS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE AUDIT COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. THE FINAL FORM 990, AS ULTIMATELY FILED WITH THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE, WAS PROVIDED TO EACH MEMBER OF THE GOVERNING BODY BEFORE IT WAS FILED.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: ALL BOARD MEMBERS ARE REQUIRED TO SIGN AND SUBMIT ANNUAL STATEMENTS OF ANY CONFLICTS OF INTEREST TO THE SECRETARY.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINES 15 A & 15B
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: AN ANNUAL REVIEW IS PERFORMED BY THE TREASURER OF ALL EMPLOYEES (12 IN TOTAL). IN 2009 THE ORGANIZATION HAD AN EXTERNAL LAW FIRM, SIMPSON THACHER & BARTLETT LLP, REVIEW THE TWO HIGHEST PAID EXECUTIVES' COMPENSATION.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE BREAST CANCER RESEARCH FOUNDATION'S FORM 990 ARE MADE AVAILABLE ON THE FOUNDATION'S WEBSITE AND UPON REQUEST.
